name: William Russ
summary: Solutions-focused, versatile management professional offering a comprehensive background supporting U.S. military operations in roles of increasing responsibility during a 9 year career in the Marines. Effective communicator who quickly masters new roles and technologies to achieve positive results with minimal resources. To include 6 years in logistics, transportation, and embarking. As well as 3 years with on-job- training, and certification as Unmanned Aviation Systems Maintenance Controller. Highlights Microsoft Office Suite, Microsoft Word, Outlook, Internet, Excel, Publisher

experience.title: Unmanned Aviation Technician Supervisor
experience.description: Oversees unmanned aviation technician operations, logistics planning, and maintenance control. Certified as Unmanned Aviation Systems Maintenance Controller. Manages flight schedules, coordination with load planners and battalions, and safety protocols; performs equipment maintenance, troubleshooting, assembly of components, and documentation. Coordinates with engineers and technicians, analyzes flight test data, and ensures mission readiness.

experience.title: Production, Planning, and Expediting Clerk
experience.description: Directed production planning and expediting activities; supervised 15+ personnel; maintained documentation; supported procurement and scheduling; developed plans and ensured adherence to timelines.

experience.title: Production, Planning, and Expediting Clerk Supervisor
experience.description: Direct supervision of 15+ military personnel; evaluated performance; promoted team approach; maintained accurate documentation; provided mentorship.

experience.title: Volunteer
experience.description: Provided emotional assistance to military spouses who lost loved ones during Operation Enduring Freedom and Operation Iraqi Freedom.

education.degree: Unmanned Aviation System Safe For Flight
Military Standard Transportation and Movements Procedures
